description: Example payloads for hiring_intent_action. The payload field stores action-specific data as JSON. This document focuses on actionable todo items. Orbit Call outputs and deal artifacts are handled separately.

payload.text: Research company background and recent product launches

linkedin_outreach.description: Todo that opens a LinkedIn people search for a specific company

orbit_company_call_schedule.description: Todo that navigates user to Orbit Call scheduling page

orbit_company_call_review.description: Todo for reviewing Orbit Call results and JD enrichment output

payload.text: Review Orbit Company Call results (JD enrichment)

follow_up_after_call.description: Todo for sending a follow-up email after an Orbit Call

backward_compatibility.note: Frontend should handle both formats. Use extractTextFromPayload() helper.

notes: All timestamps must follow ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZ
The 'text' field is required for all todo items for display purposes
External links must be complete URLs
Todo payloads represent unfinished human actions only
Orbit Call results, role clarification, and proposals are outputs, not todo items
Frontend should validate payload structure based on category
